item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 at 10:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. CVE program faces swift end after DHS fails to renew contract (1091 points | 554 comments)
2. Fun with -fsanitize=undefined and Picolibc (35 points | 1 comment)
3. Show HN: Unsure Calculator – back-of-a-napkin probabilistic calculator (644 points | 107 comments)
4. Markov Chain Monte Carlo Without All the Bullshit (2015) (129 points | 26 comments)

6. 4chan Sharty Hack And Janitor Email Leak (558 points | 719 comments)

9. OpenAI is building a social network? (209 points | 228 comments)
10. A flowing WebGL gradient, deconstructed (156 points | 28 comments)
11. Cursor IDE support hallucinates lockout policy, causes user cancellations (1173 points | 431 comments)

14. How the U.S. became a science superpower (353 points | 352 comments)
15. JSX over the Wire (190 points | 118 comments)

18. Hacktical C: practical hacker's guide to the C programming language (175 points | 152 comments)
19. Zig's new LinkedList API (it's time to learn fieldParentPtr) (211 points | 159 comments)
20. Whistleblower details how DOGE may have taken sensitive NLRB data (931 points | 429 comments)
21. Hacking the Postgres wire protocol (205 points | 47 comments)
22. Chroma: Ubisoft's internal tool used to simulate color-blindness (215 points | 64 comments)
23. Flexport (YC W14) is hiring software engineers ( | hide)
24. How to Flatpack Programs [video] (3 points | 1 comment)
25. Show HN: Torque – A lightweight meta-assembler for any processor (57 points | 18 comments)
26. The case of the UI thread that hung in a kernel call (127 points | 41 comments)
27. Fake images that fooled the world (134 points | 59 comments)
28. Archeology of React (2016) (36 points | 3 comments)
29. How dairy robots are changing work for cows and farmers (163 points | 107 comments)
30. How to win an argument with a toddler (647 points | 472 comments)
